Buffer used for sending MQTT messages, including MQTT header, MQTT topic, payload and etc.
children.name: MQTT_SEND_BUFFER
children.title: MQTT send buffer

children.help:
Recommended value: 1460 - 2048.
Buffer used for receiving MQTT messages, including MQTT header, MQTT topic, payload and etc.
children.name: MQTT_RECV_BUFFER
children.title: MQTT recv buffer

children.help:
Recommended value: 30000 - 60000.
MQTT send interval in every cycle.
A MQTT packet should be sent out in MQTT_SEND_CYCLE,
will block for MQTT_SEND_CYCLE if weak network, and return timeout.
children.name: MQTT_SEND_CYCLE
children.title: MQTT send cycle(ms)

children.help:
Recommended value: 0ms - 500ms.
MQTT receive interval in every cycle.
a MQTT packet should be received in MQTT_RECV_CYCLE,
will block for MQTT_RECV_CYCLE if weak network , and return timeout.
children.name: MQTT_RECV_CYCLE
children.title: MQTT recv cycle(ms)

children.help:
Recommended value: 3000ms - 10000ms.
MQTT ping timeout.
When MQTT_KEEP_ALIVE expired, it will start sending ping request.
If the ESP device does not receive any ping response within MQTT_PING_TIMEOUT,
it will terminate the MQTT connection.
children.name: MQTT_PING_TIMEOUT
children.title: MQTT ping timeout(ms)

children.help: If not, this library will use MQTT protocol 3.1
children.name: MQTT_PROTOCOL_311
children.title: Enable MQTT protocol 3.1.1

children.help: Enable MQTT transport over SSL with mbedtls
children.name: MQTT_TRANSPORT_SSL
children.title: Enable MQTT over SSL

children.help: Enable MQTT transport over Websocket Secure.
children.name: MQTT_TRANSPORT_WEBSOCKET_SECURE
children.title: Enable MQTT over Websocket Secure

children.help: Enable MQTT transport over Websocket.
children.name: MQTT_TRANSPORT_WEBSOCKET
children.title: Enable MQTT over Websocket

children.help: Default MQTT over TCP port
children.name: MQTT_TCP_DEFAULT_PORT
children.title: Default MQTT over TCP port

children.help: Default MQTT over SSL port
children.name: MQTT_SSL_DEFAULT_PORT
children.title: Default MQTT over SSL port

children.help: Default MQTT over Websocket port
children.name: MQTT_WS_DEFAULT_PORT
children.title: Default MQTT over Websocket port

children.help: Default MQTT over Websocket Secure port
children.name: MQTT_WSS_DEFAULT_PORT
children.title: Default MQTT over Websocket Secure port

children.help: This buffer size using for both transmit and receive
children.name: MQTT_BUFFER_SIZE
children.title: Default MQTT Buffer Size

children.help: MQTT task stack size
children.name: MQTT_TASK_STACK_SIZE
children.title: MQTT task stack size

children.help: Custom MQTT configurations.
children.name: MQTT_USE_CUSTOM_CONFIG
children.title: MQTT Using custom configurations

children.help: This will enable core selection
children.name: MQTT_TASK_CORE_SELECTION_ENABLED
children.title: Enable MQTT task core selection

children.help: Set to true if a specific implementation of message outbox is needed (e.g. persistant outbox in NVM or similar).
children.name: MQTT_CUSTOM_OUTBOX
children.title: Enable custom outbox implementation

children.help:
Enable the option can enable faster div, faster exptmod, faster sqr, fast
montgomery multiplication algorithm. Enable this option will cost about
3K ROM more than disable this option.
children.name: LTM_FAST
children.title: Use faster div, esptmod, sqr, montgomery multiplication algorithm

children.help: Enable this option and then mDNS console is to be used.
children.name: ENABLE_MDNS_CONSOLE
children.title: Enable mDNS console

children.help:
Services take up a certain amount of memory, and allowing fewer
services to be open at the same time conserves memory. Specify
the maximum amount of services here. The valid value is from 1
to 64.
children.name: MDNS_MAX_SERVICES
children.title: Max number of services

children.help:
The stacksize of the MDNS task that will be responsible for transmitting
and receiving MDNS packets.
children.name: MDNS_STACKSIZE
children.title: Max stack size of MDNS

children.help: Enable this option and then mDNS is to be used.
children.name: ENABLE_MDNS
children.title: Enable mDNS

children.help: This enables Unified Provisioning feature along with required components like Wifi-Provisioning, Protocomm and their mbedtls dependencies.
children.name: ENABLE_UNIFIED_PROVISIONING
children.title: Enable Unified Provisioning

children.help:
If you need 64-bit integer formatting support or C99 features, select this
option.
children.name: NEWLIB_LIBRARY_LEVEL_NORMAL
children.title: normal

children.help:
The newlib library which has been compiled with so-called "nano"
formatting option. This option doesn't support 64-bit integer formats, C99
features and float formats, such as positional arguments.

For more details about "nano" formatting option, please see newlib readme file,
search for '--enable-newlib-nano-formatted-io':
https://sourceware.org/newlib/README

If you do not need 64-bit integer formatting support, C99 features and float,
select this option.
children.name: NEWLIB_LIBRARY_LEVEL_NANO
children.title: nano

children.help:
The newlib library which has been compiled with so-called "float nano"
formatting option. This option doesn't support 64-bit integer formats and C99
features, but support float formats, such as positional arguments.

For more details about "nano" formatting option, please see newlib readme file,
search for '--enable-newlib-nano-formatted-io':
https://sourceware.org/newlib/README

If you do not need 64-bit integer formatting support and C99 features, but need float formats,
select this option.
children.name: NEWLIB_LIBRARY_LEVEL_FLOAT_NANO
children.title: float nano

children.help: Choose newlib library level.
children.name: NEWLIB_LIBRARY_LEVEL
children.title: newlib level

children.help:
If you need use you own C library, make this option disable. The libraries and
header files at this component will not be used.

Note: ABI of the C library of your own must be same as SDK.
children.name: NEWLIB_ENABLE
children.title: Enable newlib

children.help:
Default endpoint host name to connect to AWS IoT MQTT/S gateway

This is the custom endpoint hostname and is specific to an AWS
IoT account. You can find it by logging into your AWS IoT
Console and clicking the Settings button. The endpoint hostname
is shown under the "Custom Endpoint" heading on this page.

If you need per-device hostnames for different regions or
accounts, you can override the default hostname in your app.
children.name: AWS_IOT_MQTT_HOST
children.title: AWS IoT Endpoint Hostname

children.help:
Default port number to connect to AWS IoT MQTT/S gateway

If you need per-device port numbers for different regions, you can
override the default port number in your app.
children.name: AWS_IOT_MQTT_PORT
children.title: AWS IoT MQTT Port

children.help:
Maximum MQTT transmit buffer size. This is the maximum MQTT
message length (including protocol overhead) which can be sent.

Sending longer messages will fail.
children.name: AWS_IOT_MQTT_TX_BUF_LEN
children.title: MQTT TX Buffer Length

children.help:
Maximum MQTT receive buffer size. This is the maximum MQTT
message length (including protocol overhead) which can be
received.

Longer messages are dropped.
children.name: AWS_IOT_MQTT_RX_BUF_LEN
children.title: MQTT RX Buffer Length

children.help: Maximum number of concurrent MQTT topic filters.
children.name: AWS_IOT_MQTT_NUM_SUBSCRIBE_HANDLERS
children.title: Maximum MQTT Topic Filters

children.help:
Initial delay before making first reconnect attempt, if the AWS IoT connection fails.
Client will perform exponential backoff, starting from this value.
children.name: AWS_IOT_MQTT_MIN_RECONNECT_WAIT_INTERVAL
children.title: Auto reconnect initial interval (ms)

children.help:
Maximum delay between reconnection attempts. If the exponentially increased delay
interval reaches this value, the client will stop automatically attempting to reconnect.
children.name: AWS_IOT_MQTT_MAX_RECONNECT_WAIT_INTERVAL
children.title: Auto reconnect maximum interval (ms)

children.help:
Allows setting a different Thing Shadow RX buffer size.
This is the maximum size of a Thing Shadow message in bytes,
plus one.
children.name: AWS_IOT_SHADOW_MAX_SIZE_OF_RX_BUFFER
children.title: Maximum RX Buffer (bytes)

children.help:
Allows setting a different Thing Shadow RX buffer
size. This is the maximum size of a Thing Shadow
message in bytes, plus one.

If not overridden, the default value is the MQTT RX Buffer length plus one. If overriden, do not set higher than the default value.
children.name: AWS_IOT_OVERRIDE_THING_SHADOW_RX_BUFFER
children.title: Override Shadow RX buffer size

children.help: Maximum size of the Unique Client Id.
children.name: AWS_IOT_SHADOW_MAX_SIZE_OF_UNIQUE_CLIENT_ID_BYTES
children.title: Maximum unique client ID size (bytes)

children.help: At any given time we will wait for this many responses. This will correlate to the rate at which the shadow actions are requested
children.name: AWS_IOT_SHADOW_MAX_SIMULTANEOUS_ACKS
children.title: Maximum simultaneous responses

children.help: We could perform shadow action on any thing Name and this is maximum Thing Names we can act on at any given time
children.name: AWS_IOT_SHADOW_MAX_SIMULTANEOUS_THINGNAMES
children.title: Maximum simultaneous Thing Name operations

children.help: These are the max tokens that is expected to be in the Shadow JSON document. Includes the metadata which is published
children.name: AWS_IOT_SHADOW_MAX_JSON_TOKEN_EXPECTED
children.title: Maximum expected JSON tokens

children.help: All shadow actions have to be published or subscribed to a topic which is of the format $aws/things/{thingName}/shadow/update/accepted. This refers to the size of the topic without the Thing Name
children.name: AWS_IOT_SHADOW_MAX_SHADOW_TOPIC_LENGTH_WITHOUT_THINGNAME
children.title: Maximum topic length (not including Thing Name)

children.help: Maximum length of a Thing Name.
children.name: AWS_IOT_SHADOW_MAX_SIZE_OF_THING_NAME
children.title: Maximum Thing Name length

children.help:
Select this option to enable support for the AWS IoT platform,
via the esp-idf component for the AWS IoT Device C SDK.
children.name: AWS_IOT_SDK
children.title: Amazon Web Services IoT Platform
